The market is growing at a CAGR of 14.3% during the forecast period 2018-2025 as per new market research report titled Global Biopolymers Market(By product type – biodegradable polyesters, polyhydroxy alkenoate, polylactic acid, others. By application- food industry, textile industry, pharmaceutical and others. By end-user industry- consumer goods sector, horticulture, packaging and others). Global industry analysis, size, share, growth, trends, and forecast, 2017 – 2025, by Sheer Analytics & Insights Pvt. Ltd.

 

 

Biopolymers are generally made from the organic compounds like renewable foodstuff and starch. Being the most important raw material for most of the end-user industries, such as coating and packaging it is considered to be very useful. Adoption of biopolymer products and chemicals in the consumer, healthcare and other industrial sectors is boosting the growth of the biopolymers market. Also, biopolymers are generally preferred because of its eco-friendly nature. In the recent years, the extensive application of the biopolymers could be seen in the packaging industry. The packaging industry holds the largest market share of the biopolymers. With the rise in the usage of the eco-friendly products, the global biopolymers market is driving its growth. Apart from major end-user industries, the biopolymers are also used extensively in the agricultural sector.

 

Geographically, the global biopolymers market is divided into global regions like Europe, North America, Asia- Pacific, Middle East, LATAM, and Africa.Amongst all these regions, the North American region is expected to witness the highest CAGR, subsequently followed by European and the Asia Pacific region and Rest of The World.

 

In the very recent market research report published by Sheer Analytics and Insights Pvt. Ltd., the global biopolymers market is segmented by product type, application, end use and region. Based on its product type, the global biopolymers marketis divided into biodegradable polyesters, polyhydroxy alkenoate, polylactic acid, others. On the basis of itsapplication, we can see the division as the food industry, textile industry, pharmaceutical and others. Lastly, based on its end-user industry, the global biopolymers marketis segmented as consumer goods sector, horticulture, packaging,and others.

 

Recently, Biom’up, a French company which is known for developing collagen-based medical devices for the purpose of biosurgery, has recently announced its first sale of HEMOBLAST Bellows in the U.S. The HEMOBLAST Bellows is a kind of handheld device that is used for achieving haemostasis during the surgical procedures. It consists of a sterile, dry powder that is made of highly purified porcine collagen, thrombin and chondroitin sulphate. Biom’up has successfully conducted the clinical trial on 412 patients who are the patients of orthopedic, abdominal and cardiothoracic surgeries. The HEMOBLAST Bellows are completely based on the patented biopolymers which aim to simplify the complex surgical procedures.

 

Etienne Binant, Chief Executive Officer, commented: “The initial expressions of demand for HEMOBLAST Bellows are very encouraging and I congratulate the local sales and marketing teams led by David Clark and Steve Ford for their significant efforts in setting up our sales infrastructure in the United States. With a complete supply chain in place, we are now in an excellent position to meet this demand. Our company is fully focused on this challenge.”

 

The key industry players in the global biopolymers market include prominent companies likeAduro Biopolymers, Axcelon Biopolymers, Arkema Inc., Biome Technologies Plc, Plantic Technologies Limited, BASF SE, Novamont S.P.A, Toray Industries Inc., Rodenburg Biopolymers, Tianjin GreenBio and others.

Ltd.

 

 

Hosted PBX is a telephonic exchange system. This technology is built, managed, and delivered by a third-party service provider. It provides the small & medium-sized organizations with a PBX phone system at the time of minimizing the equipment cost. The technology enables the installation of cloud phone for remote access. It is noted that services and call control features is provided to the user’s telephone systems through the internet or through the IP based networks. Moreover, the market of the hosted PBX is boosting due to the increasing need for cloud along with the unified communication and for the bringing flexibility in the enterprise and thus Global hosted PBX market is expected to grow in the near future.

 

“The contact center industry is expected to experience explosive growth over the next few years, and we intend to be at the forefront of that explosive growth. With the launch of the Hosted Contact Center and PBX, we are giving our clients all the VOIP solutions they need to operate like a big business at an affordable price.” David Spore, President and CEO of Alcor Consulting, Inc., said while announcing the launch of Contact Center, and VoipCor Hosted PBX, two advanced VOIP solutions by Alcor.

 

Global hosted PBX market is expanding with the increasing adoption of cloud-based PBX and unified communication by the end-user. The market is also influenced by the rising demand for video conferencing and hence, the major players are looking for the improved unified communication for delivering the best platforms to their users. Another prime factor which is driving the market is instinctive web interfaces which are manageable and can be monitored by an individual. Presently, Advent of WebRTC is expected to fuel the growth of this market during the estimated period.

 

Among the other regions, North-America is estimated to hold the largest market size for the hosted PBX market during the estimated period. Increasing adoption of cloud-based PBX, internet of things, and unified communications among the others drives the critical need for effective communication and reliable in this region and therefore, helps the region for holding the largest market share of the hosted PBX market. The increasing investment by the key players for the development of cloud phone system and rising internet of things in the Asia Pacific is expected to be the fastest growing region during the projected period. Furthermore, the presence of big IT industries in the U.S has raised the demand for Global hosted PBX market in this region.

The market is currently estimated to reach US$ 39.2Bn by the year 2025. The market is growing at a CAGR of 49% during the forecast period 2018-2025. The report covers the forecast and analysis of the artificial intelligence chipset on both regional as well as global level.

 

The artificial chipsets are a group of microchips which can be used for serving a single function. These chipsets are mainly used in the smartphones, motherboards for consumer electronics and are also used in various gaming consoles and PCs for better graphics. The chipsets play a vital role in determining the system performance. Chipsets are very economical because of which it’s demand is highly growing in the market. The growth of artificial intelligence (AI) could be highly seen in AsiaPacific region like India, where the cost of the human resource is low is helping the manufacturer in investing more in the development of newer artificial chipset products. The adoption of the artificial chipsets to deal with the complex data sets is providing the customer with better solutions. These are some of the major factors that are driving the growth of the global artificial intelligence chipsets market.

 

Geographically, the global artificial intelligence chipsets market is divided into global regions like Europe, North America, Asia- Pacific, Middle East, LATAM, and Africa. The Asia Pacific region has witnessed the highest growth on the global artificial intelligence chipsets market. The increasing automation and technological advancement in the Asia Pacific region have made the region the largest market shareholder. North America and the European market follows the AsiaPacific market with its higher reliability in the artificial chipsets. The usage of the artificial chipsets could also be seen in the Latin American, Middle East, and African region.

 

In the very recent market research report published by Sheer Analytics and Insights Pvt. Ltd., the market is segmented on the basis of its technology type, component, application, end-user industry and regional demand. Based on its technology type, the global artificial intelligence chipsets market is divided into artificial superintelligence, machine learning, artificial general learning, natural language processing and others. Based on the type of its component, the market is divided into software and hardware services. On the basis of its application, the market is segmented as robotics, smartphones, medical imaging, security systems and others. Industries such as banking and financial services, healthcare, IT and telecommunication, media and entertainment and others make use of the artificial chipsets.

 

SK Telecom has recently unveiled an AI chipset that is mainly designed for boosting the computing speed of the AI service, that is currently used for the carrier’s Nugu voice assistant. A number of AI acceleration solutions would be installed in the data centre of the Nugu platform top carrier. The SK Telecom would pump up the AI service capacity by five times along with reducing the latency without installing extra servers, thus saving money.

 

According to Chung Moo-kyoung, the leader of the New Computing Lab at SK Telecom, the company started developing the AI accelerator two years ago by expecting that the number of its AI users to grow dramatically in the long term. And indeed, there was an increase in the number of monthly active users of Nugu and is expected to increase continuously. In a recent press briefing, Chung said: “Given that data transmission speeds will get even faster with the commercialization of the next-generation 5G connectivity, more data should be taken care of by the data centre.” SK Telecom becomes the first company to develop a better solution to the commercialized service.

 

Some of the key industry players in the global artificial intelligent chipsets market include Apple Inc., advanced Miro Devices, General Vision Inc., FinGenius Ltd., Google Inc., IBM Corporation, Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd., Intel Corporation, Inbenta Technologies Inc., Microsoft, and others.

node.body:
The Global Enterprise Software market in terms of revenue is expected to reach US$ 60.1 Billion by 2025 at a CAGR of 7.14% from 2018 to 2025 as per new market research report titled Global Enterprise Software Market(by types- customer relationship management (CRM), enterprise resource planning (ERP), supply chain management, business intelligence (BI), enterprise content management (ECM), and web conferencing & collaboration. By solutions- cloud virtualization, SDN switching and SDN controllers. By end-users- BFSI, media & entertainment, transportation, telecommunication, healthcare & life sciences, energy & utilities and others) – global industry analysis, size, share, growth, trends, and forecast, 2017 – 2025, by Sheer Analytics & Insights Pvt. Ltd.

In the large organizations, whether it is business or government, the enterprise software is an over-arching term for any software that is used. For a computer-based information system, it is considered to be an essential part as they provide business-related tools such as automated billing systems and payment processing. The enterprise software can also be referred to as the enterprise application software.

 

The global enterprise software market is presently at a stage of blooming and have a huge potential for growth. The demand for the enterprise software is growing owing to the tough competition, increasing disposable income, and raising awareness. The enterprise software is used to satisfy the needs of an organization and not of any individual users. It is a very flexible and fast automation process. Moreover, the new sources of data and competitive pressures are creating new necessities which is why it is estimated that the global enterprise software market will propel in the next eight years.

 

Additionally, the IT industries have also increased their investment so that they can bring modernization in the IT infrastructure. The global enterprise software is expected to have a major impact on the Asia Pacific market. The growth of expenditure on infrastructure software and application by the end-users of India and China have increased which is also creating a high opportunity for the market. The further implementation of trends of trends such as BYOD or Bring-Your-Own-Device in the enterprises which are across Middle East & Africa so that they can upgrade the flexibility of their employee has also become a major driving factor. The enterprise software market in Europe and North-America is also witnessing huge growth owing to their initially adopting the enterprise application software which was coupled by them rapidly using hybrid cloud models.

 

In the recent market research reports that were published by Sheer Analytics & Insights, the global enterprise software market has been segmented based on end-users and types. The major end-users of the global enterprise software market includes media & entertainment, telecommunication, energy & utilities, BFSI, transportation, healthcare & life science, and telecommunication. Based on types it is segmented as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Business Intelligence (BI), Web Conferencing & Collaboration, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Supply Chain Management, and Enterprise Content Management (ECM). The market is also further segmented into geographical region North America, Middle East & Africa, Asia-Pacific, and Latin America.

 

The CIOs data managers and network administrators who see that it is necessary to run a full-fledged, unmodified enterprise software at the edge of their networks, on oil rigs and factory floors, now they have the opportunity to do so. The HPE is completely certifying them complete enterprise software stacks for their EdgeLine converted infrastructure devices. It was announced by the company that this will allow the enterprises to run exactly the similar applications in the data centre, at the network edge or in the cloud. The certifications will cover various software from the key vendors such as SAP, SparkCognition, Microsoft, and Citrix to run on their EdgeLine EL 4000 and EdgeLine EL 1000.

 

Dave Kellogg quoted, “You don’t buy enterprise software, you inject it into your bloodstream.” He is a Serial Enterprise Software CEO and recently was invited as a guest on the CXOTalk.One of the leaders and experts on enterprise software development and implementation, he has enabled major business organizations successfully amalgamate enterprise software into their operation.

 

The major companies in the global enterprise software market are as follows, Oracle Corporation, Microsoft Corporation, IBM Corporation, EMC Corporation, VMware, Symantec, and SAP SE among others.
